5.2.0.title: ktxTextureLoader: Mark _useSRGBBuffers when loading an SRGB-enabled texture format
5.2.0.description:
Also set texture.format to the correct value,
since it seems the code elsewhere, like in the WebGPU engine, would
like a "base" texture format.

Completely untested patch to try and fix https://forum.babylonjs.com/t/compressed-ktx-texture-appears-too-dark/29060/4

5.2.0.title: DebugLayer : Accessors onNodeSelectedObservable
Skip invisible or unrenderable children in layout calculations
5.2.0.description:
When doing layout calculations on a container, we should skip over children which are invisible or un-renderable. This will fix the case where a visible child would cause a container with `adaptWidthToChildren` to extend its width, even though it shouldn't.

As a general principle, invisible children should not take up any space in the layout. (This is what we are already doing for stack panel.)

Related forum issue: https://forum.babylonjs.com/t/gui-stackpanel-not-settings-correct-width-height-when-it-has-invisible-child-controls/29149

5.2.0.title: Add normal input to clear coat Block
Add a flag to use opacity instead of diffuse texture for transparent shadows.
Unicode/emoji characters in Playground are lost upon Save
Fix wrong PG key saving
switch sandbox to double (and fix a tiny GC issue with audio)
include loaders and serializers in typedoc definition
New flag to preserve scaling when using gizmos
5.2.0.description:
Followup https://forum.babylonjs.com/t/mesh-with-scaling-1-1-1-will-set-an-unbelievable-scaling-when-drag-positiongizmo/28850/13
and https://forum.babylonjs.com/t/how-can-i-get-the-correct-scaling-and-rotation-with-boundingboxgizmo/29243/3

Option to preserve TransformNode scaling when using Gizmos.
Off by default to preserve back compat.

5.2.0.title: remove legacy directory
update package lock
Different selection priorities for nodes and frames dependent of marquee or click selecting
add overrideCloneAlphaBetaRadius to ArcRotateCamera
5.2.0.description:
Adds new property overrideCloneAlphaBetaRadius to the class ArcRotateCamera. This allows the parameter to setTarget to be specified when animating the camera's target property.

For example, when using FramingBehavior the override can be set to true, which then allows the framingTime (i.e. speed) of the framing animation to be changed independently, without altering anything else about the animation.

Forum discussion: https://forum.babylonjs.com/t/zoomonmesheshierarchy-inconsistent-camera-rotation/29100/8

5.2.0.title: gltf2interface must be transpiled, otherwise it's not available.
support debug in older versions
Add some missing onPropertyChangedObservable to inspector…
fix: getPositionData missing slice of vertex positions
5.2.0.description:
Change getPositionData  to slice the vertex position array after getting it from the geometry to fix the issue that when getPositionData is called repeatedly it only worked correctly the first time.

PG: https://playground.babylonjs.com/#SYQW69#1034
Forum: https://forum.babylonjs.com/t/bug-mesh-getpositiondata-blows-up-everytime-you-run-it/29246

5.2.0.title: Additional WebXR image tracking changes for native integration
5.2.0.description:
This PR includes some more changes for WebXR Image Tracking integration for BabylonNative. and some cleanup from the previous change: https://github.com/BabylonJS/Babylon.js/pull/12097

The primary change is to  update nativeXRFrame to pull the results array directly from the frame object rather than marshalling back to native code every time.  This should improve per-frame CPU load.

See: https://github.com/BabylonJS/BabylonNative/pull/1032 for the consuming BabylonNative change.

5.2.0.title: Add support for GLTF 2.0 Serializer KHR_materials_specular
5.2.0.description:
GLTF 2.0 Serializer is missing the KHR_materials_specular extension
This PR add support for the KHR_materials_specular to the GLTF2.0 serializer.
Values are mapped as

- specularFactor : metallicF0Factor 
- specularTexture : metallicReflectanceTexture 
- specularColorFactor : metallicReflectanceColor
- specularColorTexture : reflectanceTexture

using default value or `undefined ` to decide wether or not the data should be serialized.
default values are 
- specularFactor : 1.0f 
- specularColorFactor : [1.0f,1.0f,1.0f] 

Test has been conducted using this standard sample [model](https://github.com/KhronosGroup/glTF-Sample-Models/tree/master/2.0/SpecularTest)
Materials has been loaded and serialized succesfully without any diff.
close #8968

5.2.0.title: Fixing typings for camera detachControl
Physics,scene Bug fixes
5.2.0.description:
- Bug fix https://forum.babylonjs.com/t/inspector-bug-with-wireframe-not-being-aligned-on-mesh/29021/10
Clone for wireframe mesh was also cloning physics impostor. And the impostor having a delta rotation, it was applied twice (parent's delta + delta) causing invalid rendering
- Bug fix https://forum.babylonjs.com/t/physicsimpostor-ignoreparent-causes-crash/29194/4
- scene `skipPointerDownPicking` : do not pick ray in scene when not appropriate. This is causing massive performance drop on native.

5.2.0.title: Fix minor shader compiler issues
5.2.0.description:
Changes:
 - Allow semicolons in shader single line comments
 - ~~Allow indented multiline macros~~
 
Related post in forum showing reproduction for the single line comment issue:
- https://forum.babylonjs.com/t/possible-shader-compiler-bug-with-single-line-comments/29182

~~There are no reports for the indented multiline macro issue, but I verified locally that indenting a multiline macro would break compiler, and with this fix, it works.~~

5.2.0.title: Fix babylon mesh parsing, materials were not reattached.
Move the local server to compile using ts-loader
5.2.0.description:
Webpack will now compile typescript using ts-loader and will not use the compiled sources from the dist folders of the dev / lts packages.
Note that this might break LTS development, but as this hasn't started yet it is not urgent.

The time it takes to compile is actually the same (might be a little slower this way), but the server won't let you load the resources while compiling.

The server will now wait before reloading the resources while compiling.

5.2.0.title: Revert the missing fix and add some logs
Add support for Iridescence in PBR and GLTF
5.2.0.description:
* Support iridescence in PBR Material
* Support iridescence in NME PBR Material
* Support iridescence in GLTF Loader
* Support iridescence in GLTF Exporter

Doc is available here: https://documentation-git-iridescence-babylonjs.vercel.app/divingDeeper/materials/using/masterPBR#iridescence on PR https://github.com/BabylonJS/Documentation/pull/521

![iridescence_nme](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16655165/162496948-0509c192-58d0-44ab-9358-a23565ef8bcd.png)

Can Be tested on Playgrounds:
https://babylonsnapshots.z22.web.core.windows.net/refs/pull/12365/merge/index.html#2FDQT5#1505
https://babylonsnapshots.z22.web.core.windows.net/refs/pull/12365/merge/index.html#2FDQT5#1507
https://babylonsnapshots.z22.web.core.windows.net/refs/pull/12365/merge/index.html#2FDQT5#1508

5.2.0.title: Reset cached vertex data after CPU skinning is turned off
5.2.0.description:
When CPU skinning is turned off (by setting computeBonesUsingShaders to true), then the vertex positions and normals are reset to cached values. With this PR the cached values are then nulled so that if CPU skinning is later enabled again, the cache will be re-populated with the latest values.

Issue: https://github.com/BabylonJS/Babylon.js/issues/12364
Forum: https://forum.babylonjs.com/t/computebonesusingshaders-on-off-on-is-causing-a-major-bug/29162/18

Test PGs: https://playground.babylonjs.com/#SYQW69#1031
https://playground.babylonjs.com/#SYQW69#1014

5.2.0.title: make param defaults explicit for function getPositionData
5.2.0.description: For the function getPositionData that I PR'ed a few months ago, the params applySkeleton and applyMorph default to false implicitly (an oversight). This PR just makes those param defaults explicit for clarity and proper typing (e.g. for TS).

5.2.0.title: Prevent alt+click shortcut to drop elbow on complex node connections
Fix default settings in video texture
Avoid double loading a scene when the playground is saved.

5.1.0.title: add timestamp to CDN assets
5.1.0.description:
Every time a snapshot is created a timestamp.js file willbe updated. this timestamp will be loaded before all babylon resources, and it is never cached.
The timestamp will be used to load from the CDN, which will cache for longer time with the query string included in the cache, meaning - the resources will be cached until a new timestamp is generated.

This way we will not have to force-refresh anymore after a nightly.

5.0.4.title: On parse, reconnects the keys of the virtual keyboard
Allow editors packages to be included in a single project
5.0.4.description:
Due to the way the shared ui components were declared it was not possible to include both editors in a single typescript project.
This generates a different namespace to the shared ui components so they are not declared twice.

5.0.4.title: use ignoreAdaptiveScaling on containers width adaptWidthToChildren or adaptHeightToChildren
5.0.4.description:
See forum thread: https://forum.babylonjs.com/t/gui-adaptwidthtochildren-not-working-with-adaptive-scaling/28911/7

Containers with adaptWidthToChildren or adaptHeightToChildren currently have adaptative scaling applied twice, once when their children's dimensions are computed and once when their own dimensions are computed. This PR simply turns off adaptive scaling on the relevant property when it's being adapted to the children's dimensions.

5.0.4.title: Fix Color3.asArray, Color4.asArray, Color4.toArray and docs for Color…
5.0.4.description:
…4.fromHexString.

As proposed in the forum: https://forum.babylonjs.com/t/several-small-issues-with-color3-and-color4/29092/2

Three small fixes for Color3 and Color4:
- Simpler implementation of Color3.asArray and Color4.asArray as the original implementation was slow in my experience.
- Use FloatArray as first argument of Color4.toArray so it can write to Float32Array.
- Improve documentation for Color4.fromHexString to document behaviour, including the change introduced in Babylon 5.

5.0.4.title: fix physics regression
assign the number of textures correctly
5.0.4.description:
The number of samples was not assigned correctly and was always 1 when binding to multisampled multiview (i.e. the oculus browser).

This PR fixes that.

5.0.4.title: rotate the hand mesh opposed to the based transform node.
Update the GLTF breaking change in What's new with a workaround.
Playground fails permanently when Babylon.js 3.3 is selected
5.0.4.description:
Fixes #12336
Removes 3.3,
moves the 4.2.X branch to 4.2.1

5.0.4.title: Fix item duplication when gui editor is opened through the playground.

5.0.3.title: fix mergemesh when using RH
5.0.3.description:
We are already taking in account the worldmatrix as the vertices are transformed by it in the process
We are also inverting indices in that case

So there is no need for a side override as the mesh will be left handed

5.0.3.title: Fix instance color forwarding for PBR Instances
5.0.3.description:
Followup https://forum.babylonjs.com/t/vertex-error-and-no-colors-on-thin-instances-after-upgrade/28492/13
Instance colors were not properly forwarded for PBR materials

5.0.1.title: revamp declarations
5.0.1.description: Making declaration build a bit more future-safe

5.0.1.title: empty loadingUIText setter for null engine
5.0.1.description:
using null engine and setting loading ui text to it causes crash...
added 'do nothing' setter for `loadingUIText`

5.0.1.title: Only update the GUI size when arrow control's drag is stopped.
Update Display Grid Parameters
5.0.1.description: Updates the display grid parameters to bring it into line with the other controls. Introduces three new icons as part of this change

5.0.1.title: Fix overflows on left panel
5.0.1.description: Fixes issue where the tree view and the creation buttons could overflow and disappear. This is a temporary solution which just adds scrollbars when necessary. We will want to explore other design solutions in future.

5.0.1.title: update the give feedback link to the beta thread
5.0.1.description: Feedback link now points to the beta thread instead of the alpha thread.

5.0.1.title: Removed outdated section about building from readme.md.
Added a new flag for checking double sided mesh in collision
5.0.1.description:
Added a new flag for checking double sided mesh in collision detection (disable by default)

follow up https://forum.babylonjs.com/t/movewithcollisions-cant-handle-doublesided-meshes/28928
double sided face are evaluated 2 times, by design. With this change, they are only evaluated once.
To not break back compat, it's hidden behind a flag.
To enable it :
```
BABYLON.Collider.DoubleSidedCheck = true;
```

5.0.1.title: Changes to saving and cleanup
5.0.1.description:
Fixes a bug where saving the GUI multiple times would trigger a crash.

Also modifies the behavior around saving and restoring GUI properties when opening a live GUI scene. Now we store a list of all observers attached to the control, remove them all, and then restore them when the editor is closed. This seems like the best way to handle observers - they should not trigger while the GUI editor is open.

5.0.1.title: Beta release
5.0.1.description: Turns off the alpha warning message and adds the beta flag to signify the release of the GUI editor beta! Will merge it tomorrow assuming all is well :)

5.0.1.title: Update components on unit change
5.0.1.description: Adds back in the units comparison in shouldComponentUpdate, which allows the input components to re-render if units change. (unitLocked is still removed as this is now part of the UnitButton component rather than the input itself)

5.0.1.title: Fix deletion of descendant controls in the gui editor
5.0.1.description: Without this change, deleting a button, for example, would only delete it on the live texture but not on the linked GUI editor

5.0.1.title: Separate reframing with selected controls and the entire screen
update build config script
5.0.1.description:
How to use:

From the command line run the following:
node ./scripts/updateBuildConfig.js versionType
versionType can be either "major", "minor", "patch", or "prerelease"
When prerelease the second argument is the prerelease id (alpha, beta, rc). keep empty to keep the same one.
 
This will be triggered by the CI when running the right pipeline (publish minor, publish major, publish patch)

Commit the file change afterwards and submit a pull request to first allow the tests to run.

5.0.1.title: Add the viewer to the automated build process
5.0.1.description:
**To be merged after 5.0 release!**

This adds the viewer to the automated build process.

5.0.2.title: Adjust behavior of NME selection to only select a frame if there aren…
5.0.2.description: …'t nodes selected. Also fix an error that showed up on compile.

5.0.2.title: make sure externals are only the public dev packages
5.0.2.description:
Shared UI components were considered as external package instead of embedded. due to a recent change I have made.

This fixes the issue.

5.0.2.title: add ability to change node parent in inspector
Inspector - Empty mesh nodes should display with the mesh icon
